intro: Rabdosia albopilosa, commonly known as the white-haired rabdosia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine white hairs. Its flowers are typically pale blue or violet, arranged in whorled clusters along the stem. Rabdosia albopilosa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
